extDescription.message: Preview local Markdown files with beautiful GitHub-style rendering

externalLink.description: Prefix shown in tooltip for external links

exportFailed.description: Error message prefix when export fails

setupImportantDesc.message: To use this extension, you need to enable "Allow access to file URLs" setting.

setupStep1Desc.message: Click the button below to open the extensions management page.

setupStep1Note.message: Alternatively, you can type chrome://extensions/ in Chrome's address bar and press Enter.

setupStep2Desc.message: Look for "Local Markdown Viewer" in the extensions list.

setupStep3Desc.message: Click the "Details" button on the "Local Markdown Viewer" card.

setupStep4Desc.message: Turn ON the "Allow access to file URLs" switch.

setupWhatIsThisDesc.message: Enabling this setting allows Local Markdown Viewer to access pages opened with the file:// protocol (local files). Specifically, when you open a .md or .markdown file on your computer in Chrome, this extension can read the Markdown text, convert it to HTML, and display it beautifully.

setupWhyNeededDesc.message: For security reasons, Chrome prohibits extensions from accessing local files by default. Since this extension is designed to display local files, you (the user) must explicitly grant permission.

setupSafety1.message: No file content is sent externally - Your Markdown file content will never be transmitted to the internet

setupSafety2.message: Read-only - Files are never modified, deleted, or overwritten

setupSafety3.message: Display only - Simply reads opened Markdown files, converts them to HTML format, and displays them

setupSafety4.message: Only displays content in Markdown files - If a Markdown file contains image links (e.g., ![](image.png)), those images are displayed, but files not referenced will not be accessed

setupSafety5.message: Respects your privacy - No data collection, tracking, or advertising whatsoever

setupSafety6.message: Open source - All code is publicly available and verifiable

setupCompleteDesc.message: Now, when you open a local .md or .markdown file in Chrome, it will be beautifully displayed in GitHub style.

setupUsageDesc.message: Right-click a Markdown file (.md or .markdown) → "Open with" → Select "Google Chrome". Alternatively, you can drag and drop the file into Chrome's address bar.
